title.en: Biographies of Wei Bao and Peng Yue
title.raw: 《魏豹彭越列傳》 Biographies of Wei Bao and Peng Yue

sentences.zh: 魏豹者，故魏諸公子也。

translations.literal: Wei Bao, his person former Wei various princes.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Bao was one of the princes of the former state of Wei.

sentences.zh: 其兄魏咎，故魏時封為寧陵君。

translations.literal: His elder brother Wei Jiu, former Wei time enfeoffed as Ningling jun.
translations.idiomatic: His elder brother Wei Jiu had been enfeoffed as Lord of Ningling during the time of the former Wei.

sentences.zh: 秦滅魏，遷咎為家人。

translations.literal: Qin extinguished Wei, moved Jiu as commoner.
translations.idiomatic: When Qin destroyed Wei, they demoted Jiu to commoner status.

sentences.zh: 陳勝之起王也，咎往從之。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng uprising king, Jiu went followed him.
translations.idiomatic: When Chen Sheng rose in rebellion and became king, Jiu went to follow him.

sentences.zh: 陳王使魏人周市徇魏地，魏地已下，欲相與立周市為魏王。

translations.literal: Chen king sent Wei person Zhou Shi attack Wei land, Wei land already surrendered, wished mutually establish Zhou Shi as Wei king.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chen sent the Wei man Zhou Shi to seize Wei territory. When Wei territory had already surrendered, they wished to establish Zhou Shi as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 周市曰：「天下昏亂，忠臣乃見。

translations.literal: Zhou Shi said: 'World chaotic confused, loyal ministers then appear.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Shi said: 'When the world is in chaotic confusion, loyal ministers then appear.'

sentences.zh: 今天下共畔秦，其義必立魏王後乃可。」

translations.literal: Now world together rebel Qin, its righteousness certainly establish Wei king posterity then possible.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the world together rebels against Qin. For righteousness, we must certainly establish a descendant of the Wei royal family.'

sentences.zh: 齊、趙使車各五十乘，立周市為魏王。

translations.literal: Qi, Zhao sent chariots each fifty, established Zhou Shi as Wei king.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Zhao each sent fifty chariots and established Zhou Shi as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 市辭不受，迎魏咎於陳。

translations.literal: Shi declined not accepted, welcomed Wei Jiu at Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Shi declined and did not accept. He welcomed Wei Jiu at Chen.

sentences.zh: 五反，陳王乃遣立咎為魏王。

translations.literal: Five times returned, Chen king then sent established Jiu as Wei king.
translations.idiomatic: After five trips back and forth, the King of Chen then sent and established Jiu as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破陳王，乃進兵擊魏王於臨濟。

translations.literal: Zhang Han already broke Chen king, then advanced troops attacked Wei king at Linji.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han had already defeated the King of Chen, then advanced his troops and attacked the King of Wei at Linji.

sentences.zh: 魏王乃使周市出請救於齊、楚。

translations.literal: Wei king then made Zhou Shi go request rescue at Qi, Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei then sent Zhou Shi to go request rescue from Qi and Chu.

sentences.zh: 齊、楚遣項它、田巴將兵隨市救魏。

translations.literal: Qi, Chu sent Xiang Tuo, Tian Ba lead troops follow Zhou Shi rescue Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Chu sent Xiang Tuo and Tian Ba to lead troops following Zhou Shi to rescue Wei.

sentences.zh: 章邯遂擊破殺周市等軍，圍臨濟。

translations.literal: Zhang Han then attacked broke killed Zhou Shi etc. army, surrounded Linji.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han then attacked, broke, and killed Zhou Shi and his army, surrounding Linji.

sentences.zh: 咎為其民約降。

translations.literal: Jiu for his people made agreement surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Jiu made an agreement to surrender on behalf of his people.

sentences.zh: 約定，咎自燒殺。

translations.literal: Agreement made, Jiu self burned killed.
translations.idiomatic: Having made the agreement, Jiu burned himself to death.

sentences.zh: 魏豹亡走楚。

translations.literal: Wei Bao fled ran Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Bao fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王予魏豹數千人，復徇魏地。

translations.literal: Chu Huai king gave Wei Bao several thousand persons, again seized Wei land.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu gave Wei Bao several thousand men and he again seized Wei territory.

sentences.zh: 項羽已破秦，降章邯。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu already broke Qin, surrendered Zhang Han.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had already defeated Qin and Zhang Han had surrendered.

sentences.zh: 豹下魏二十餘城，立豹為魏王。

translations.literal: Bao took Wei twenty remaining cities, established Bao as Wei king.
translations.idiomatic: Bao conquered more than twenty cities of Wei and they established Bao as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 豹引精兵從項羽入關。

translations.literal: Bao led elite troops followed Xiang Yu entered pass.
translations.idiomatic: Bao led elite troops following Xiang Yu into the Pass.

sentences.zh: 漢元年，項羽封諸侯，欲有梁地，乃徙魏王豹於河東，都平陽，為西魏王。

translations.literal: Han first year, Xiang Yu enfeoffed feudal lords, wished have Liang land, then moved Wei king Bao to Hedong, capital Pingyang, made Western Wei king.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Han, Xiang Yu enfeoffed the feudal lords. Desiring to have Liang territory, he moved King Bao of Wei to Hedong, with Pingyang as capital, making him King of Western Wei.

sentences.zh: 漢王還定三秦，渡臨晉，魏王豹以國屬焉，遂從擊楚於彭城。

translations.literal: Han king returned pacified Three Qin, crossed Linjin, Wei king Bao with country belonged thereto, then followed attacked Chu at Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king returned and pacified the Three Qin regions. He crossed the Linjin ford, and King Bao of Wei submitted his country to him. Bao then followed and attacked Chu at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 漢敗，還至滎陽，豹請歸視親病，至國，即絕河津畔漢。

translations.literal: Han defeated, returned to Xingyang, Bao requested return view parent illness, reached country, immediately cut Yellow River crossings rebelled Han.
translations.idiomatic: The Han forces were defeated and returned to Xingyang. Bao requested to return home to see his ailing parent. Upon reaching his country, he immediately cut the Yellow River crossings and rebelled against Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王聞魏豹反，方東憂楚，未及擊，謂酈生曰：「緩頰往說魏豹，能下之，吾以萬戶封若。」

translations.literal: Han king heard Wei Bao rebelled, just east worried Chu, not yet attacked, said to Li Sheng: 'Slow manner go persuade Wei Bao, able subjugate him, I with ten thousand households enfeoff you.'
translations.idiomatic: The Han king heard that Wei Bao had rebelled. He was already concerned about Chu in the east and had not yet attacked. He said to Li Sheng: 'Go persuade Wei Bao in a gentle manner. If you can bring him to submission, I will enfeoff you with ten thousand households.'

sentences.zh: 酈生說豹。

translations.literal: Li Sheng persuaded Bao.
translations.idiomatic: Li Sheng persuaded Bao.

sentences.zh: 豹謝曰：「人生一世閒，如白駒過隙耳。

translations.literal: Bao declined said: 'Human life one world interval, like white colt passing crevice ear.
translations.idiomatic: Bao declined, saying: 'A man's life in this world is brief, like a white colt passing through a crevice.'

sentences.zh: 今漢王慢而侮人，罵詈諸侯群臣如罵奴耳，非有上下禮節也，吾不忍復見也。」

translations.literal: Now Han king arrogant insults people, curses feudal lords ministers like cursing slave ear, not has superiors inferiors ritual propriety, I cannot bear again see.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Han king is arrogant and insults people, cursing the feudal lords and ministers as if they were slaves. He observes no proper ritual between superiors and inferiors. I cannot bear to see him again.'

sentences.zh: 於是漢王遣韓信擊虜豹於河東，傳詣滎陽，以豹國為郡。

translations.literal: Thereupon Han king sent Han Xin attack captured Bao at Hedong, transmitted to Xingyang, made Bao country into commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Han king sent Han Xin to attack and capture Bao in Hedong. He was sent to Xingyang, and Bao's kingdom was made into a commandery.

sentences.zh: 漢王令豹守滎陽。

translations.literal: Han king ordered Bao defend Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king ordered Bao to defend Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 楚圍之急，周苛遂殺魏豹。

translations.literal: Chu besieged urgent, Zhou Ke then killed Wei Bao.
translations.idiomatic: The siege by Chu grew urgent, and Zhou Ke then killed Wei Bao.

sentences.zh: 彭越者，昌邑人也，字仲。

translations.literal: Peng Yue, his person Changyi person, style name Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue was a man of Changyi. His style name was Zhong.

sentences.zh: 常漁鉅野澤中，為群盜。

translations.literal: Constantly fished Juye marsh middle, made group bandits.
translations.idiomatic: He constantly fished in the Juye marshes and became a bandit leader.

sentences.zh: 陳勝、項梁之起，少年或謂越曰：「諸豪桀相立畔秦，仲可以來，亦效之。」

translations.literal: Chen Sheng, Xiang Liang uprising, youth some said Yue: 'Various heroes outstanding mutually establish rebel Qin, Zhong can come, also imitate them.'
translations.idiomatic: When Chen Sheng and Xiang Liang rose in rebellion, some youths said to Yue: 'The various heroes are establishing themselves and rebelling against Qin. Zhong can come and imitate them.'

sentences.zh: 彭越曰：「兩龍方鬬，且待之。」

translations.literal: Peng Yue said: 'Two dragons just fighting, moreover wait it.'
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue said: 'Two dragons are fighting. Let's wait and see.'

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，澤閒少年相聚百餘人，往從彭越，曰：「請仲為長。」

translations.literal: Dwelt year remaining, marsh among youths mutually gathered hundred remaining persons, went followed Peng Yue, said: 'Request Zhong be chief.'
translations.idiomatic: After dwelling there more than a year, over a hundred youths gathered together in the marshes and went to follow Peng Yue, saying: 'We request that Zhong be our leader.'

sentences.zh: 越謝曰：「臣不願與諸君。」

translations.literal: Yue declined said: 'Subject not wish with various lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Yue declined, saying: 'I do not wish to be with you gentlemen.'

sentences.zh: 少年彊請，乃許。

translations.literal: Youths strongly requested, then permitted.
translations.idiomatic: The youths strongly insisted, and he then agreed.

sentences.zh: 與期旦日日出會，後期者斬。

translations.literal: With them appointed next day sun rise meet, late arriver behead.
translations.idiomatic: He made an appointment with them to meet at sunrise the next day. Anyone who arrived late would be beheaded.

sentences.zh: 旦日日出，十餘人后，後者至日中。

translations.literal: Next day sun rose, ten remaining persons late, latest arrived at noon.
translations.idiomatic: The next day at sunrise, over ten people were late, with the last arriving at noon.

sentences.zh: 於是越謝曰：「臣老，諸君彊以為長。

translations.literal: Thereupon Yue declined said: 'Subject old, various lords strongly made chief.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Yue declined, saying: 'I am old, yet you gentlemen strongly insist on making me chief.'

sentences.zh: 今期而多後，不可盡誅，誅最後者一人。」

translations.literal: Now appointed time but many late, cannot all execute, execute latest one person.'
translations.idiomatic: Now we set an appointment time, but many were late. I cannot execute them all—execute only the last one.'

sentences.zh: 令校長斬之。

translations.literal: Ordered colonel behead him.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the colonel to behead him.

sentences.zh: 皆笑曰：「何至是？

translations.literal: All laughed said: 'How to this extent?
translations.idiomatic: They all laughed, saying: 'How could it come to this?'

sentences.zh: 請後不敢。」

translations.literal: Request later not dare.'
translations.idiomatic: We request that in the future we won't dare be late.'

sentences.zh: 於是越乃引一人斬之，設壇祭，乃令徒屬。

translations.literal: Thereupon Yue then led one person behead him, set altar sacrificed, then commanded followers.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Yue led one man and beheaded him. He set up an altar and sacrificed, then commanded his followers.

sentences.zh: 徒屬皆大驚，畏越，莫敢仰視。

translations.literal: Followers all greatly startled, feared Yue, none dared look up.
translations.idiomatic: His followers were all greatly startled. They feared Yue and none dared look up at him.

sentences.zh: 乃行略地，收諸侯散卒，得千餘人。

translations.literal: Then went raided territory, gathered feudal lords scattered soldiers, obtained thousand remaining persons.
translations.idiomatic: He then went raiding territory and gathered the scattered soldiers of the feudal lords, obtaining over a thousand men.

sentences.zh: 沛公之從碭北擊昌邑，彭越助之。

translations.literal: Pei gong when followed Dang north attacked Changyi, Peng Yue assisted him.
translations.idiomatic: When Pei Gong followed Dang north to attack Changyi, Peng Yue assisted him.

sentences.zh: 昌邑未下，沛公引兵西。

translations.literal: Changyi not yet fallen, Pei gong led troops west.
translations.idiomatic: Changyi had not yet fallen when Pei Gong led his troops west.

sentences.zh: 彭越亦將其眾居鉅野中，收魏散卒。

translations.literal: Peng Yue also led his multitude dwelt Juye middle, gathered Wei scattered soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue also led his multitude to dwell in the Juye marshes and gathered Wei's scattered soldiers.

sentences.zh: 項籍入關，王諸侯，還歸，彭越眾萬餘人毋所屬。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji entered pass, kinged feudal lords, returned home, Peng Yue multitude ten thousand remaining persons none belonged to.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji entered the Pass, made himself king over the feudal lords, and returned home. Peng Yue's multitude of over ten thousand men belonged to no one.

sentences.zh: 漢元年秋，齊王田榮畔項王，（漢）乃使人賜彭越將軍印，使下濟陰以擊楚。

translations.literal: Han first year autumn, Qi king Tian Rong rebelled Xiang king, Han then sent person granted Peng Yue general seal, made take Jiyin to attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn of the first year of Han, King Tian Rong of Qi rebelled against Xiang Yu. Han then sent someone to grant Peng Yue a general's seal and had him take Jiyin to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚命蕭公角將兵擊越，越大破楚軍。

translations.literal: Chu commanded Xiao gong Jiao lead troops attack Yue, Yue greatly broke Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Chu commanded Xiao Gong Jiao to lead troops and attack Yue. Yue greatly defeated the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 漢王二年春，與魏王豹及諸侯東擊楚，彭越將其兵三萬餘人歸漢於外黃。

translations.literal: Han king second year spring, with Wei king Bao and feudal lords east attacked Chu, Peng Yue led his troops thirty thousand remaining persons returned Han at Waihuang.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the second year of Han, along with King Bao of Wei and the feudal lords, they attacked Chu to the east. Peng Yue led his troops—over thirty thousand men—to return to Han at Waihuang.

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「彭將軍收魏地得十餘城，欲急立魏後。

translations.literal: Han king said: 'Peng general took Wei territory obtained ten remaining cities, wished urgently establish Wei posterity.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king said: 'General Peng has taken Wei territory and obtained over ten cities. I wish to urgently establish a descendant of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 今西魏王豹亦魏王咎從弟也，真魏後。」

translations.literal: Now Western Wei king Bao also Wei king Jiu younger brother, true Wei posterity.'
translations.idiomatic: Now King Bao of Western Wei is also a younger brother of King Jiu of Wei. He is truly a descendant of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 乃拜彭越為魏相國，擅將其兵，略定梁地。

translations.literal: Then appointed Peng Yue as Wei prime minister, autonomously led his troops, raided pacified Liang territory.
translations.idiomatic: He then appointed Peng Yue as Prime Minister of Wei, gave him autonomous command of his troops, and had him raid and pacify Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 漢王之敗彭城解而西也，彭越皆復亡其所下城，獨將其兵北居河上。

translations.literal: Han king when defeated Pengcheng retreated west, Peng Yue all again lost his taken cities, alone led his troops north dwelt river upon.
translations.idiomatic: When the Han king was defeated at Pengcheng and retreated west, Peng Yue lost all the cities he had taken. He alone led his troops north to dwell along the river.

sentences.zh: 漢王三年，彭越常往來為漢游兵，擊楚，絕其後糧於梁地。

translations.literal: Han king third year, Peng Yue constantly came went made Han roaming troops, attacked Chu, cut their rear grain in Liang territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Han, Peng Yue constantly moved about as Han's roaming troops. He attacked Chu and cut off their rear supply lines in Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 漢四年冬，項王與漢王相距滎陽，彭越攻下睢陽、外黃十七城。

translations.literal: Han fourth year winter, Xiang king with Han king confronted Xingyang, Peng Yue attacked took Suiyang, Waihuang seventeen cities.
translations.idiomatic: In winter of the fourth year of Han, Xiang Yu and the Han king confronted each other at Xingyang. Peng Yue attacked and took Suiyang and Waihuang—seventeen cities in total.

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，乃使曹咎守成皋，自東收彭越所下城邑，皆復為楚。

translations.literal: Xiang king heard it, then made Cao Jiu defend Chenggao, from east recovered Peng Yue taken city towns, all again became Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard of it and made Cao Jiu defend Chenggao. From the east, he recovered the cities and towns Peng Yue had taken, all of which again became Chu territory.

sentences.zh: 越將其兵北走穀城。

translations.literal: Yue led his troops north fled Gucheng.
translations.idiomatic: Yue led his troops north and fled to Gucheng.

sentences.zh: 漢五年秋，項王之南走陽夏，彭越復下昌邑旁二十餘城，得穀十餘萬斛，以給漢王食。

translations.literal: Han fifth year autumn, Xiang king south ran Yangxia, Peng Yue again took Changyi beside twenty remaining cities, obtained grain ten remaining ten thousand dou, to supply Han king food.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn of the fifth year of Han, when Xiang Yu fled south to Yangxia, Peng Yue again took over twenty cities near Changyi. He obtained over one hundred thousand dou of grain to supply the Han king with food.

sentences.zh: 漢王敗，使使召彭越并力擊楚。

translations.literal: Han king defeated, sent messenger summoned Peng Yue combine strength attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was defeated and sent a messenger to summon Peng Yue to combine forces and attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 越曰：「魏地初定，尚畏楚，未可去。」

translations.literal: Yue said: 'Wei territory newly pacified, still fears Chu, not yet can go.'
translations.idiomatic: Yue said: 'Wei territory has only just been pacified. It still fears Chu. I cannot leave yet.'

sentences.zh: 漢王追楚，為項籍所敗碧陵。

translations.literal: Han king pursued Chu, by Xiang Ji defeated Bilin.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king pursued Chu but was defeated by Xiang Ji at Bilin.

sentences.zh: 乃謂留侯曰：「諸侯兵不從，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Then said Liu Hou: 'Feudal lords troops not follow, make it what?'
translations.idiomatic: He then said to Liu Hou: 'The feudal lords' troops are not following. What should I do?'

sentences.zh: 留侯曰：「齊王信之立，非君王之意，信亦不自堅。

translations.literal: Liu Hou said: 'Qi king Xin establishment, not lord king intention, Xin also not self firm.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Hou said: 'The establishment of King Xin of Qi was not Your Majesty's intention. Xin is also not firm in his position.'

sentences.zh: 彭越本定梁地，功多，始君王以魏豹故，拜彭越為魏相國。

translations.literal: Peng Yue originally pacified Liang territory, merit much, beginning lord king because Wei Bao reason, appointed Peng Yue as Wei prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue originally pacified Liang territory and has much merit. At first, Your Majesty appointed Peng Yue as Prime Minister of Wei because of Wei Bao.

sentences.zh: 今豹死毋後，且越亦欲王，而君王不蚤定。

translations.literal: Now Bao died no posterity, moreover Yue also desires king, yet lord king not early decide.
translations.idiomatic: Now Bao is dead with no posterity. Moreover, Yue also desires to be king, yet Your Majesty has not decided early.

sentences.zh: 與此兩國約：即勝楚，睢陽以北至穀城，皆以王彭相國；

translations.literal: With these two countries covenant: namely defeat Chu, Suiyang north to Gucheng, all make king Peng prime minister;
translations.idiomatic: Make a covenant with these two countries: If we defeat Chu, from Suiyang north to Gucheng, all will be made to king Peng the prime minister;

sentences.zh: 從陳以東傅海，與齊王信。

translations.literal: From Chen east reach sea, give Qi king Xin.
translations.idiomatic: from Chen east to the sea, give to King Xin of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王信家在楚，此其意欲復得故邑。

translations.literal: Qi king Xin family in Chu, this his intention wishes again obtain former fief.
translations.idiomatic: King Xin of Qi's family is in Chu. His intention is to regain his former fief.

sentences.zh: 君王能出捐此地許二人，二人今可致；

translations.literal: Lord king able relinquish discard this territory grant two persons, two persons now can obtain;
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty can relinquish this territory and grant it to these two men, then these two men can now be obtained;

sentences.zh: 即不能，事未可知也。」

translations.literal: Namely cannot, matter not yet know.'
translations.idiomatic: If you cannot, then the matter is not yet known.'

sentences.zh: 於是漢王乃發使使彭越，如留侯策。

translations.literal: Thereupon Han king then sent messenger sent Peng Yue, like Liu Hou strategy.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Han king sent a messenger to Peng Yue, following Liu Hou's strategy.

sentences.zh: 使者至，彭越乃悉引兵會垓下，遂破楚。

translations.literal: Messenger arrived, Peng Yue then all led troops assembled Gaixia, then broke Chu.
translations.idiomatic: When the messenger arrived, Peng Yue led all his troops and assembled at Gaixia, then defeated Chu.

sentences.zh: （五年）項籍已死。

translations.literal: (Fifth year) Xiang Ji already dead.
translations.idiomatic: (In the fifth year) Xiang Ji was already dead.

sentences.zh: 春，立彭越為梁王，都定陶。

translations.literal: Spring, established Peng Yue as Liang king, capital Dingtao.
translations.idiomatic: In spring, Peng Yue was established as King of Liang, with Dingtao as capital.

sentences.zh: 六年，朝陳。

translations.literal: Sixth year, audience Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he attended court at Chen.

sentences.zh: 九年，十年，皆來朝長安。

translations.literal: Ninth year, tenth year, all came audience Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth and tenth years, he all came to attend court at Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 十年秋，陳豨反代地，高帝自往擊，至邯鄲，徵兵梁王。

translations.literal: Tenth year autumn, Chen Xi rebelled Dai territory, Gao Di personally went attack, reached Handan, conscripted troops Liang king.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn of the tenth year, Chen Xi rebelled in Dai territory. Gao Di personally went to attack him, reached Handan, and conscripted troops from the King of Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁王稱病，使將將兵詣邯鄲。

translations.literal: Liang king claimed illness, made general lead troops go Handan.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Liang claimed illness and sent a general to lead troops to Handan.

sentences.zh: 高帝怒，使人讓梁王。

translations.literal: Gao Di angered, sent person reprimand Liang king.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Di was angered and sent someone to reprimand the King of Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁王恐，欲自往謝。

translations.literal: Liang king feared, wished personally go apologize.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Liang was fearful and wished to go personally to apologize.

sentences.zh: 其將扈輒曰：「王始不往，見讓而往，往則為禽矣。

translations.literal: His general Hu Zhe said: 'King beginning not go, seen reprimand then go, go then become captive.
translations.idiomatic: His general Hu Zhe said: 'Your Majesty did not go at first, but now goes after being reprimanded. If you go, you will become a captive.'

sentences.zh: 不如遂發兵反。」

translations.literal: Not as then send troops rebel.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to simply send troops and rebel.'

sentences.zh: 梁王不聽，稱病。

translations.literal: Liang king not listen, claimed illness.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Liang did not listen and claimed illness.

sentences.zh: 梁王怒其太仆，欲斬之。

translations.literal: Liang king angered his grand coachman, wished behead him.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Liang was angered by his grand coachman and wished to behead him.

sentences.zh: 太仆亡走漢，告梁王與扈輒謀反。

translations.literal: Grand coachman fled ran Han, informed Liang king with Hu Zhe planned rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: The grand coachman fled to Han and informed that the King of Liang was planning rebellion with Hu Zhe.

sentences.zh: 於是上使使掩梁王，梁王不覺，捕梁王，囚之雒陽。

translations.literal: Thereupon emperor sent messenger ambush Liang king, Liang king not aware, captured Liang king, imprisoned him Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor sent a messenger to ambush the King of Liang. The King of Liang was unaware and was captured, then imprisoned in Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 有司治反形己具，請論如法。

translations.literal: Officials judged rebellion evidence already complete, requested adjudicate as law.
translations.idiomatic: The officials judged that the evidence of rebellion was already complete and requested adjudication according to law.

sentences.zh: 上赦以為庶人，傳處蜀青衣。

translations.literal: Emperor pardoned made commoner, transmitted dwell Shu Qingyi.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor pardoned him and made him a commoner, then sent him to dwell in Qingyi in Shu.

sentences.zh: 西至鄭，逢呂后從長安來，欲之雒陽，道見彭王。

translations.literal: West reached Zheng, encountered Empress Lü from Chang'an come, wished go Luoyang, on road saw Peng king.
translations.idiomatic: Going west to Zheng, he encountered Empress Lü coming from Chang'an, who wished to go to Luoyang. On the road she saw the King of Peng.

sentences.zh: 彭王為呂后泣涕，自言無罪，願處故昌邑。

translations.literal: Peng king for Empress Lü wept tears, self said no crime, wished dwell former Changyi.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Peng wept tears for Empress Lü and said of himself that he had no crime, wishing to dwell in his former Changyi.

sentences.zh: 呂后許諾，與俱東至雒陽。

translations.literal: Empress Lü permitted agreed, with together east reached Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü agreed and together they went east to Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 呂后白上曰：「彭王壯士，今徙之蜀，此自遺患，不如遂誅之。

translations.literal: Empress Lü reported emperor said: 'Peng king strong warrior, now move him Shu, this self leave calamity, not as then execute him.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü reported to the emperor, saying: 'The King of Peng is a strong warrior. Now moving him to Shu—this will leave us calamity. It would be better to simply execute him.'

sentences.zh: 妾謹與俱來。」

translations.literal: Concubine respectfully with together came.'
translations.idiomatic: I have respectfully brought him with me.'

sentences.zh: 於是呂后乃令其舍人彭越復謀反。

translations.literal: Thereupon Empress Lü then ordered her attendant falsely accuse Peng Yue again planned rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Empress Lü ordered her attendant to falsely accuse Peng Yue of planning rebellion again.

sentences.zh: 廷尉王恬開奏請族之。

translations.literal: Court minister Wang Tiankai memorialized requested exterminate clan him.
translations.idiomatic: The court minister Wang Tiankai memorialized and requested that his clan be exterminated.

sentences.zh: 上乃可，遂夷越宗族，國除。

translations.literal: Emperor then approved, then exterminated Yue clan, kingdom abolished.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then approved, and Yue's clan was exterminated, his kingdom abolished.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：魏豹、彭越雖故賤，然已席卷千里，南面稱孤，喋血乘勝日有聞矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Wei Bao, Peng Yue although formerly lowly, however already rolled up thousand li, south faced called solitary, bloodied rode victory days had heard.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Though Wei Bao and Peng Yue were formerly lowly, they had already rolled up a thousand li, faced south and called themselves sovereign, bloodied their weapons and rode victory—their fame was heard daily.

sentences.zh: 懷畔逆之意，及敗，不死而虜囚，身被刑戮，何哉？

translations.literal: Cherished rebellion treason intention, when defeated, not died but captured prisoner, body suffered punishment execution, what?
translations.idiomatic: They cherished thoughts of rebellion and treason. When defeated, they did not die but were captured as prisoners, their bodies suffered execution—what of this?

sentences.zh: 中材已上且羞其行，況王者乎！

translations.literal: Medium talent already above moreover shamed their conduct, moreover kings?
translations.idiomatic: Even men of medium talent and above would be ashamed of their conduct—how much more so kings!

sentences.zh: 彼無異故，智略絕人，獨患無身耳。

translations.literal: They no different cause, wisdom strategy surpassed people, alone suffered no body.
translations.idiomatic: They had no different cause, their wisdom and strategy surpassed others, they alone suffered from having no body to preserve.

sentences.zh: 得攝尺寸之柄，其雲蒸龍變，欲有所會其度，以故幽囚而不辭云。

translations.literal: Obtained grasped inch foot handle, their cloud steamed dragon changed, wished had meet their measure, because of this imprisoned not declined.
translations.idiomatic: Once they obtained and grasped even a tiny bit of power, they would steam like clouds and change like dragons. They wished to meet their ambitions, which is why they were imprisoned and did not decline death.
